channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Top analyst still thinks we’re on the cusp of a new boom for the economy, but investors aren’t with him: ‘Markets remain choppy’
item.description: Morgan Stanley’s Mike Wilson says he needs to see more before giving the “all-clear” on chances of a further near-term correction.

item.title: 'No Kings' protesters filmed having children bash Trump piñata
item.description: Saturday's "No Kings" protest near the Broadview, Illinois, Immigration and Customs Enforcement facility saw a Trump piñata get bashed.

item.title: China’s Damaging Influence on American Democracy
item.description: New York is a microcosm of these potential dangers.

item.title: Hillary Clinton leads brigade of left-wing mockery, bewilderment over Trump's viral 'No Kings' protest video
item.description: Democrats denounce President Donald Trump's AI-generated video depicting himself dropping brown sludge on crowds of "No Kings" protesters.

item.title: Wisconsin Officials Violated Voter Registration Laws During Record-Breaking Election
item.description: More than 30 election offices failed to inactivate suspect registrants after the state's nationally-watched Supreme Court election.

item.title: IVF Is Not Pro-Life
item.description: President Trump still doesn’t get it.

item.title: Former Sears boss says CEOs won’t challenge Trump’s tariffs out of ‘cowardice’—but the holidays are fast approaching, and ‘the party is over’
item.description: He expects many shelves at retailers will be empty this holiday season.

item.title: The best way to earn billionaire status is to follow in Warren Buffett’s footsteps: 15% of billionaires derive net worth from the finance industry
item.description: U.S. billionaires are collectively worth about $7.6 trillion

item.title: Trump’s Argentina Gamble
item.description: Extending money to the South American nation is risky but could help spur reforms that would create a prosperous, powerful American ally.

item.title: Foreign Interference? Leftist Groups Try To Nuke Voter Citizenship Rule Supported By 83% Of Americans
item.description: Leftist 'voter rights' groups are throwing all they can at stopping the EAC from changing the registration form to ensure only U.S. citizens can vote.

item.title: ‘Make Assassinations Great Again’: Leftist Demonstrators Call For Murder Of Trump
item.description: We now live in a society where the left not only accepts but celebrates throngs of haters carrying signs calling for murder.

item.title: 60 Minutes Takes Left-Wing Propaganda To A New Level With Discredited Ex-DOJ Lawyer Interview
item.description: 60 Minutes tried its very hardest to portray Erez Reuveni as a courageous hero who was victimized by a lawless Trump-run DOJ.

item.title: Trump says Ukraine could win war with Russia, but it's unlikely
item.description: President Trump said Monday that Ukraine could win its more than two-year war with Russia, but the odds of victory are unlikely.

item.title: Walmart has spent more than $110 million buying malls this year in a move to become a property owner, not just a tenant
item.description: Walmart already owns most of its locations. But recent deals are part of an emerging pattern.

item.title: Republicans declare 'Coal Week' as Trump administration leads fossil-fuel comeback
item.description: Senate Republicans will introduce a resolution Monday declaring "Coal Week."

item.title: Air traffic controllers are becoming Uber drivers and restaurant servers on top of six-day airport shifts to make ends meet during government shutdown
item.description: Deemed essential workers, controllers are required to work during the shutdown, but will receive a $0 paycheck starting next week.
